title: Could Brian Thomas Jr. be a legitimate trade target for Patriots this offseason?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots need to strengthen their offense, possibly by acquiring wideout Brian Thomas Jr. from the Jaguars.
Brian Thomas Jr. had a strong 2024 season but regressed with 707 yards in 2025 under coach Liam Coen.
The Patriots might trade a 2026 first-round pick and a player like DeMario Douglas for Thomas if he becomes available.

title: 3 takeaways from Team USA men’s hockey’s OT win over Sweden in Olympics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Quinn Hughes scored the overtime winner as Team USA defeated Sweden 2-1 in the 2026 Olympics men's hockey quarterfinal.
Charlie McAvoy delivered key defensive plays for Team USA, finishing third in ice time with 19:22 against Sweden.
Four Bruins players, including McAvoy, still compete for a gold medal, while Elias and Hampus Lindholm's Olympic run ended.

title: Pittsfield armored vehicle company is largest ICE contract in Mass.
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Lenco Industries, based in Pittsfield, secured $5.2 million in ICE contracts for its BearCat armored vehicles in the past year.
Governor Maura Healey criticized the contracts, urging local businesses to avoid ICE work and expressing disapproval of ICE's actions.
Lenco has received state grants to increase production but turned down $10 million from ICE to focus on other markets.

title: Former State Police union head, lobbyist get more prison time for fraud, racketeering
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Dana Pullman, former State Police union president, sentenced to two years in prison for racketeering and fraud.
Anne Lynch, former union lobbyist, sentenced to 15 months for involvement in wire fraud and tax crimes.
Pullman and Lynch ordered to pay restitution for using union funds for personal expenses, including a $20,000 kickback.

title: Boston 25 News head meteorologist Kevin Lemanowicz departing after 3 decades with the station
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Kevin Lemanowicz, Boston 25's chief meteorologist, will step down at the end of February after nearly 30 years.
Lemanowicz joined Boston 25 News in 1996 and covered significant weather events such as the 2011 tornadoes and 2023 flooding.
Boston 25 praised Lemanowicz for his weather coverage excellence and deep community connection over the decades.

title: Red Sox release statement after outcry over flawed jersey design
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox admit design flaw in 2026 home jerseys, with overlapping lettering and striping, prompting fan backlash.
Original jersey design was selected by Red Sox, produced according to specification by partner Fanatics.
Updated jerseys correcting spacing issues will be ready for Opening Day against San Diego Padres on April 3.

title: Pawtucket police find firearms in ice rink shooter’s storage locker, identify ‘courageous citizens’ who intervened
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Police found firearms, ammunition, and accessories in Robert Dorgan's storage locker after the Pawtucket ice rink shooting.
Robert Dorgan, 56, killed his ex-wife and son during a high school hockey game in Pawtucket, Rhode Island.
Citizens, including Michael Black and Robert Rattenni, subdued the shooter while others provided critical first aid to victims.

title: MBTA announces service changes and suspensions for March
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: MBTA announced weekend service suspensions on the Orange Line and four Commuter Rail lines for March upgrades.
Shuttle buses will replace Orange Line services from Back Bay to Forest Hills starting February 28 to March 8.
Commuter Rail lines affected include Fitchburg, Haverhill, Lowell, and Newburyport/Rockport for North Station signal improvements.

title: Rafael Devers reacts to Red Sox exec’s ‘pick up a glove’ comment
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rafael Devers, now with the Giants, was traded from the Red Sox in June 2025 after internal conflicts.
Red Sox chairman Tom Werner criticized Devers for not filling in at first base during an injury crisis.
Devers dismissed Werner's comments, preferring to focus on his future with the Giants and leave the past behind.

title: Adam Schefter maps out potential price for Patriots in Maxx Crosby trade
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: NFL insider Adam Schefter predicts a high trade cost for Maxx Crosby, likening it to the Micah Parsons package.
Crosby's potential trade from the Raiders involves tensions with Tom Brady's associate, Alex Guerrero, over injury management.
The Patriots, with the 31st first-round pick, are potential suitors as their season sack ranking was only 26th in the league.
